name: Croatoa
descriptions: Croatoa is a tribal and one of the inhabitants of Point Lookout in 2277.
Croatoa has been a member of the tribe for some time, as he describes himself as "not so new" compared to the Lone Wanderer, who he welcomes upon their acceptance into the tribe.
He possesses a unique shovel that helps him to grow the punga, as it is covered in a fertilizer of some kind.
He can be found wandering inside the outer walls of the Ark & Dove Cathedral, oftentimes tending to the punga.

Croatoa will not become hostile like the unnamed tribals at the cathedral if the Lone Wanderer sides with Desmond during Thought Control, but will still attack if he sees them attacking any other tribals.
With the Child at Heart perk or by passing a Speech check, the Lone Wanderer can get the fertilizer shovel from him.
* Only if the Lone Wanderer has got the fertilizer shovel from him.
Croatoa appears only in the Fallout 3 add-on Point Lookout.

Croatoan Island is the historical name of Hatteras Island in the Outer Banks of North Carolina. Most famously, the word "Croatoan" was found carved into a tree at the site of the missing Roanoke Colony.

topics.response_text: Look to Jackson. He is the one who knows.

topics.topic_text: Why did you attack the mansion?
topics.response_text: That hill is holy. It must be cleared. Jackson told us this.

topics.topic_text: How do you get so much Punga Fruit to grow here?
topics.response_text: Punga grows strong. I help Punga grow stronger.
We dream. Dream of a better world, not falling apart like ours.

topics.topic_text: I love digging in the dirt, but I never can get anything to grow right.
topics.response_text: It feels good to work with dirt, doesn't it? Some people call it work, but they don't understand.

topics.topic_text: Guess you and plants think alike, huh?
topics.response_text: Maybe. We are both simple. But simple is not the same as stupid.
Please wait until my meditations are complete.

topics.topic_text: Can you share your secret to getting them to grow?
topics.response_text: My only secret is patience. If I could share it with you, I would.

conversation.response_text: Learn from the Punga. Accept simplicity.
